First flavor review; go easy on me.


**Setup:** Troll V2 RDA, dual SS316L 24x2/36g fused Clapton coils, 0.1 ohms, full cotton wicks. Temp at 370Â°F, power at 140W.

**Testing:** TFA Espresso @ 2.5%, steeped 12 days

**Description:** Well this is not what I expected from an espresso flavoring. I thought it would be a very, very strong coffee almost to the point of being overpowering. However, like the curse of most coffee vape flavors, it doesn't really taste like coffee. Rather,  I almost get a taste reminiscent of mud with a few randomly placed coffee notes on the exhale.

**Off-flavors:** Mud/dirt. Also a strong chemical note in any recipe I've mixed this in, down to 0.5% which only gets worse with steeping.

**Throat hit:** 4/10, as expected with an espresso

**Uses and pairings:** You could maybe use this in a bakery flavor as a coffee note but I wouldn't go above 0.25%. If you're interested in making a bleach flavored ejuice, this flavoring would be useful as a main note to capture that chemical bleach taste.

**Notes:** I picked up a 10ml of this when I started mixing a few months ago. I have more than half of it left. This is by far the worst flavoring I've tried and it absolutely kills any recipe it is in. Unless you already have some, I would not recommend buying it. If there's anyone here who can actually make use of this flavoring, I am curious to know how because I find the chemical flavor so strong it's unbearable.
